intro: Cousinia turkmenorum, commonly known as Turkmenian cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. It has hairy, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Cousinia turkmenorum is often found in steppes and rocky areas, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
